input_text: COVID-19 Deaths Continue to Drop in France (url)
prompt:
You are an advanced information extraction system. Your task is to identify and extract specific arguments related to a specified event in a given sentence. The event, trigger word, and argument roles are provided below, along with examples to guide you in accurately extracting the relevant information.

Event: 'death'
Sentence: 'COVID-19 Deaths Continue to Drop in France (url)'

Please extract the event trigger and the following arguments from the sentence. Note that some roles might not exist and some might be wrongly labeled:
- Patient (Examples: Deaths; The virus claimed the life of the [patient].; Many [people] have died due to the pandemic.; The disease led to the death of [thousands].)
- Cause (Examples: Deaths; [COVID-19] killed millions of people.; The [infection] resulted in numerous fatalities.; [Heart failure] was the cause of his death.)
- Time (Examples: Deaths; He passed away last [night].; The deaths occurred over a short [period].; Many deaths were reported during the [pandemic].)
- Location (Examples: Deaths; The deaths occurred in [hospitals].; Many deaths were reported in [nursing homes].)

Your response should list the event trigger followed by each argument role and the exact extracted text from the sentence, maintaining the original wording and case. Format your response as shown below:

Event Trigger: <event trigger>
Role1: <extracted text>
Role2: <extracted text>
...
Here is the ontology for reference:

Ontology:
[
  {
    "event_name": "infect",
    "argument_role": "Agent",
    "role_description": "The entity that is causing the disease, the pathogen",
    "example_sentence": [
      "I caught the [virus] from my friend.",
      "The [bacteria] infected the patient.",
      "the [pathogen] is very contagious."
    ]
  },
  {
    "event_name": "infect",
    "argument_role": "Person",
    "role_description": "The entity being infected by the disease or pathogen",
    "example_sentence": [
      "The Covid-19 virus first infected a [person] in Wuhan.",
      "Several [people] have been affected by the virus."
    ]
  },
  {
    "event_name": "spread",
    "argument_role": "Person",
    "role_description": "The group of people or people that the infection has spread to",
    "example_sentence": [
      "The virus has spread to the entire [population].",
      "I got the virus from my [friend] who I visited over vacation.",
      "The virus has infected 30% of the [community]."
    ]
  },
  {
    "event_name": "spread",
    "argument_role": "Agent",
    "role_description": "The entity or pathogen causing the disease that is spreading",
    "example_sentence": [
      "The [disease] spreads rapidly among children.",
      "The [infection] has reached every continent.",
      "The [virus] is airborne, making it easy to spread."
    ]
  },
  {
    "event_name": "spread",
    "argument_role": "Location",
    "role_description": "The place where the disease is spreading",
    "example_sentence": [
      "The virus is spreading across the [Los Angeles city]",
      "Outbreaks are occurring in multiple [regions].",
      "The spread of the disease has been rapid in [urban areas]."
    ]
  },
  {
    "event_name": "spread",
    "argument_role": "Time",
    "role_description": "The time period over which the disease is spreading",
    "example_sentence": [
      "The virus spread rapidly over a short [period].",
      "In just a few [days], the infection rate doubled.",
      "The disease has been spreading for several [months]."
    ]
  },
  {
    "event_name": "spread",
    "argument_role": "Method",
    "role_description": "The means by which the disease spreads",
    "example_sentence": [
      "The virus spreads through [airborne transmission].",
      "Contaminated surfaces are a common [method] of spreading the disease.",
      "Close contact with infected individuals is the main [way] the virus spreads."
    ]
  },
  {
    "event_name": "symptom",
    "argument_role": "Indicator",
    "role_description": "The specific physiological feature indicating the disease",
    "example_sentence": [
      "I have a [fever].",
      "He is experiencing severe [headaches].",
      "Common [symptoms] include coughing and sneezing."
    ]
  },
  {
    "event_name": "symptom",
    "argument_role": "Person",
    "role_description": "The individual displaying the symptom",
    "example_sentence": [
      "The [patient] reported feeling dizzy.",
      "[She] has been showing symptoms of the flu.",
      "Several [people] have developed a rash."
    ]
  },
  {
    "event_name": "symptom",
    "argument_role": "Duration",
    "role_description": "The length of time the symptom is experienced",
    "example_sentence": [
      "The fever lasted for [three days].",
      "He has been coughing for over a [week].",
      "The symptoms persisted for a [month]."
    ]
  },
  {
    "event_name": "prevent",
    "argument_role": "Agent",
    "role_description": "The entity trying to prevent the infection",
    "example_sentence": [
      "[Health officials] are working to prevent the outbreak.",
      "[Vaccines] help prevent disease spread.",
      "[People] are taking measures to prevent infection."
    ]
  },
  {
    "event_name": "prevent",
    "argument_role": "Method",
    "role_description": "The means used to prevent the infection",
    "example_sentence": [
      "Wearing masks is an effective [prevention strategy].",
      "[Handwashing] can prevent the spread of germs.",
      "[Social distancing] is a way to prevent infection."
    ]
  },
  {
    "event_name": "prevent",
    "argument_role": "Target",
    "role_description": "The disease or condition being prevented",
    "example_sentence": [
      "Vaccines are designed to prevent [measles].",
      "Efforts are being made to prevent the [flu].",
      "Measures are in place to  prevent [COVID-19]."
    ]
  },
  {
    "event_name": "control",
    "argument_role": "Agent",
    "role_description": "The entity making efforts to control the spread of the disease",
    "example_sentence": [
      "The [government] is trying to control the pandemic.",
      "[Healthcare workers] are working to control the spread.",
      "[Communities] are taking steps to control infections."
    ]
  },
  {
    "event_name": "control",
    "argument_role": "Action",
    "role_description": "The specific measure or action taken to control the spread",
    "example_sentence": [
      "[Lockdowns] were implemented to control the virus.",
      "[Vaccination] campaigns aim to  control the outbreak.",
      "[Quarantine] measures help to control the spread."
    ]
  },
  {
    "event_name": "control",
    "argument_role": "Target",
    "role_description": "The disease or infection being controlled",
    "example_sentence": [
      "Efforts to control [COVID-19] are ongoing.",
      "Strategies to control [malaria] are in place.",
      "Measures are being taken to control the [flu]."
    ]
  },
  {
    "event_name": "cure",
    "argument_role": "Agent",
    "role_description": "The entity providing the cure or treatment",
    "example_sentence": [
      "[Doctors] are working to cure the patient.",
      "Researchers are developing [treatments] to  cure the disease.",
      "[Medications] can help cure infections."
    ]
  },
  {
    "event_name": "cure",
    "argument_role": "Patient",
    "role_description": "The individual receiving the cure or treatment",
    "example_sentence": [
      "The treatment helped cure the [patient].",
      "[She] was cured after receiving medication.",
      "Many [patients] that were ill recovered with proper care."
    ]
  },
  {
    "event_name": "cure",
    "argument_role": "Method",
    "role_description": "The means or method used to achieve the cure",
    "example_sentence": [
      "[Antibiotics] are used to cure bacterial infections.",
      "[Surgery] can cure certain conditions.",
      "[Therapies] aim to cure mental health issues."
    ]
  },
  {
    "event_name": "death",
    "argument_role": "Patient",
    "role_description": "The individual who died",
    "example_sentence": [
      "The virus claimed the life of the [patient].",
      "Many [people] have died due to the pandemic.",
      "The disease led to the death of [thousands]."
    ]
  },
  {
    "event_name": "death",
    "argument_role": "Cause",
    "role_description": "The cause of death",
    "example_sentence": [
      "[COVID-19] killed millions of people.",
      "The [infection] resulted in numerous fatalities.",
      "[Heart failure] was the cause of his death."
    ]
  },
  {
    "event_name": "death",
    "argument_role": "Time",
    "role_description": "The time when the death occurred",
    "example_sentence": [
      "He passed away last [night].",
      "The deaths occurred over a short [period].",
      "Many deaths were reported during the [pandemic]."
    ]
  },
  {
    "event_name": "death",
    "argument_role": "Location",
    "role_description": "The placewhen the death occurred",
    "example_sentence": [
      "The deaths occurred in [hospitals].",
      "Many deaths were reported in [nursing homes]."
    ]
  }
]
output_text:
Event Trigger: death
Patient: deaths
Cause: COVID-19
Time: continue to drop
Location: France
